      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
      verificationComparisonType - verificationComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, CASE_INSENSITIVE

      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      browserAttributeType - the desired attribute type of the browser window under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
      verificationComparisonType - verificationComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, CASE_INSENSITIVE
      verificationType - verificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyComparativeRelation

      public static void verifyComparativeRelation​(Number expectedValue, Number actualValue, Verifications.ComparativeRelationType comparativeRelationType, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType.
      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
      comparativeRelationType - verifyComparativeRelation.GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS, EQUALS
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyComparativeRelation

      public static void verifyComparativeRelation​(Number expectedValue, Number actualValue, Verifications.ComparativeRelationType comparativeRelationType, Verifications.VerificationType verificationType, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType if verificationType is POSITIVE, or not related if verificationType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
      comparativeRelationType - verifyComparativeRelation.GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS, EQUALS
      verificationType - verificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyFileExists

      public static void verifyFileExists​(String fileFolderName, String fileName, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that a certain file exists. Attempts to find the file only once.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyFileExists

      public static void verifyFileExists​(String fileFolderName, String fileName, int numberOfRetries, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that a certain file exists. Attempts to find the file for the desired NumberOfRetries.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyFileExists

      public static void verifyFileExists​(String fileFolderName, String fileName, int numberOfRetries, Verifications.VerificationType verificationType, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that a certain file exists if verificationType is POSITIVE, or doesn't exist if verificationType is NEGATIVE. Attempts to find the file for the desired NumberOfRetries.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      verificationType - verificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyJSONFileContent

      public static void verifyJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, String referenceJsonFilePath, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyJSONFileContent

      public static void verifyJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyJSONFileContent

      public static void verifyJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, Verifications.VerificationType verificationType, String... customLogMessage)

      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison

      verificationType - verificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • verifyJSONFileContent

      public static void verifyJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, String jsonPathToTargetArray, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the target array extracted by parsing the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      jsonPathToTargetArray - a jsonpath that will be parsed to point to the target JSON Array
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyJSONFileContent

      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON

    • verifyElementMatches

      public static void verifyElementMatches​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, Verifications.VisualValidationEngine visualValidationEngine, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the current image of the target element matches the expected reference image using the desired VisualValidationEngine. Supports OpenCV natively, and Applitools Eyes. To use Eyes you need to configure your applitoolsApiKey in the path.properties file
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      visualValidationEngine - VisualValidationEngine.EXACT_OPENCV, EXACT_EYES, STRICT_EYES, CONTENT_EYES, LAYOUT_EYES
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in * the execution report

    • verifyElementMatches

      public static void verifyElementMatches​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, Verifications.VisualValidationEngine visualValidationEngine, Verifications.VerificationType verificationType, String... customLogMessage)
      verifies that the current image of the target element matches the expected reference image using the desired VisualValidationEngine if verificationType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if verificationType is NEGATIVE. Supports OpenCV natively, and Applitools Eyes. To use Eyes you need to configure your applitoolsApiKey in the path.properties file
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver

      verificationType - verificationType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in * the execution report

    • verifyApiResponseEquals

      public static void verifyApiResponseEquals​(io.restassured.response.Response response, String expectedValue, String JSONPath, String... customLogMessage)
      Verify that two objects are equal
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
      JSONPath - JSONPath of the actual value of this verification; the JSONPath expression that will be evaluated in order to extract the desired value [without the trailing $.], please refer to these urls for examples: https://support.smartbear.com/alertsite/docs/monitors/api/endpoint/jsonpath.html http://jsonpath.com/
      customLogMessage - a custom message that will appended to this step in the execution report

    • verifyApiResponseEquals

      Parameters:
